result.execSummary:
The defendant Devonta L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing Officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, and supervision fees out of bail on deposit, if any, and the balance shall be due on or before 9/17/2016. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 9 days TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonta L Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 9 days TIME SERVED.

COURT ORDERED THE DEFENDANT to pay costs, surcharges, assessments, and supervision fees out of bail on deposit, if any, and the balance shall be due on or before 09-17-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

Received and filed with court:
Pretrial Incarceraton Credit Form

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Devonta L Brown in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State Court amended the charge from Resisting or Obstructing an Officer  TO  Obstructing and Officer under Wisconsin Stats. SFP.15(16) a U forfeiture. Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea.

Defendant Devonta L Brown in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. At request of defense case is adjourned to branch 23 for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 08-17-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 8/17/15 at 8:30 am, Branch 23.vb

Defendant Devonta L Brown in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Case recalled at 2:51. Appearances remain the same.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court. Morgan Wilz appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant previsouly checked in, but left before case was called. Court stayed a bench warrant until this afternoon.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant checked-in at 9:301 am, but has left.  Defense counsel requests another plea and sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46 and stays a bench warrant to the next date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Devonta L Brown not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM014302  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-17-15

Defendant Devonta L Brown in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  
Defendant Devonta L Brown in custody.  
James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
